department.dept_long_name: Committee on the Study of Religion

course.title: Harvard's History and Evolving Religious Identity
course.meeting_text: W., F., at 11, and hour to be arranged.
course.description: An examination of the intellectual and institutional history of the University that leads students through a chronological exploration of key events and significant presidents. Among themes to be considered are European antecedents, developments in faculty, changes in student life, curricular alterations, as well as the maturation of the built environment. Significant attention is paid to the evolution of the religious context of the school, which was a vital component of the University's identity for several centuries.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 2297.
